00001 #include <windows.h>
00002 #include "winfuncs.h"
00003 
00004 extern int DialogInUse;
00005 extern float lightColor[3];
00006 extern HWND hWnd;
00007 
00008 // Hook function for color common dialog window
00009 UINT APIENTRY ColorDialogHook(HWND hdlg, UINT msg, WPARAM, LPARAM)
00010 {
00011     switch (msg)
00012     {
00013         case WM_INITDIALOG:
00014         {
00015             if(DialogInUse == 1)  // Ambient
00016                 SetWindowText(hdlg, "Choose Ambient Color");
00017             if(DialogInUse == 2)  // Diffuse
00018                 SetWindowText(hdlg, "Choose Diffuse Color");
00019             if(DialogInUse == 3)  // Specular
00020                 SetWindowText(hdlg, "Choose Specular Color");
00021             return TRUE;
00022         }
00023 
00024         default:
00025             return FALSE;
00026     }
00027 }
00028 
00029 void GetLightColor()
00030 {
00031     COLORREF colors[16];
00032     COLORREF colorRGB = RGB(lightColor[0]*255, lightColor[1]*255, lightColor[2]*255);
00033     CHOOSECOLOR colorDialog;
00034     memset(&colorDialog,0,sizeof(colorDialog));
00035     memset(colors,255,sizeof(colors));
00036     colorDialog.lStructSize = sizeof(CHOOSECOLOR);
00037     colorDialog.hwndOwner = hWnd;
00038     colorDialog.rgbResult = colorRGB;
00039     colorDialog.lpCustColors = colors;
00040     colorDialog.Flags = CC_FULLOPEN | CC_RGBINIT | CC_ENABLEHOOK;
00041     colorDialog.lpfnHook = (LPCCHOOKPROC)ColorDialogHook;
00042     ChooseColor(&colorDialog);
00043     lightColor[0] = (float)GetRValue(colorDialog.rgbResult)/255;
00044     lightColor[1] = (float)GetGValue(colorDialog.rgbResult)/255;
00045     lightColor[2] = (float)GetBValue(colorDialog.rgbResult)/255;
00046 }
